com.yantra.api.omp.promising

Interface findInventory

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface findInventory

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document findInventory(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The findInventory API returns a suggested Option, based on the criteria for searching supplied in the input XML.

    • Method Detail

      • findInventory

        org.w3c.dom.Document findInventory(YFSEnvironment env,
                                   org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                            throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                   java.rmi.RemoteException

        The findInventory API returns a suggested Option, based on the criteria for searching supplied in the input XML. These suggested Options have the node and the date from which an item can be sourced from. In addition to the suggested Option, a list of other reasonable Options, based on the input criteria, is returned. This list does not enumerate all possible Options, but provide reasonable matches based on the input, and a search algorithm that avoids presenting redundant combinations. The number of Options provided can be controlled by setting the MaximumRecords attribute. The api supports searching Inventory for Product (PROD), Delivery (DS) and Provided Service (PS) items. However, finding Capacity for PS and DS Option items are not allowed by the api.

        ShipNode or list of ShipNodes may be passed optionally. If passed then sourcing rule is not read. Unassigned demands will not be considered when checking for availability.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:

          com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemDetailsUE
          com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemListUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetDeliveryLeadTimeUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetExternalInventoryForItemListUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetExternalInventoryUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetExternalResourcePoolCapacityUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetAvailabilityCorrectionsUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetTagNoUE
          com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemAssociationsUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetExternalSupplyUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetItemNodeCostForSourcingUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetSupplyCorrectionsUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetDemandCorrectionsUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetItemSubstitutesOverrideUE
          com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue.YCPGetNodeMinimumNotificationTimeUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetAvailabilityCorrectionsForItemListUE

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions:None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Additional Information:

        The api also returns a list of substitute (Associated) Items if the IsSubstitutionAllowed flag is not passed as N in the input and customer scheduling constraints do not prohibit substitution. The substitute Items that have an associated quantity greater than one are not considered for substitution. Substitution is allowed only for Product items and only at the shipping node. If the user exit YCMGetItemAssociationsUE is implemented, then it is called to find the associated items which can be used for substitution. If the User Exit does not return any Product Class for the substitute Item, the Product class of the original item is returned back. However, if a Product Class is returned back from the substitute item, the same will be given as part of the output.

        This api will consider the Preferred Substitutes for the item, if such are configured or allowed by YFSGetItemSubstitutesOverrideUE. If the Preferred Substitute is found it will automatically be used first, regardless of IsSubstitutionAllowed flag. If the Preferred Substitute is not available, system will attempt to substitute it with the original item, only when IsSubstitutionAllowed flag is set to 'Y'. There should be only one Preferred Substitute for an item. The substitute item should have an associated quantity to be 1. No quantity validation will be performed. If the Original Item is not available, regular substitution will be used. If original item and substitutes are not found at the shipping node, system will attempt to procure substitute items (preferred or regular) or the original.

        If the flag IsPartialSubstitutionAllowed is set to 'Y' in the Promise Element, this api will return the Inventory options with the partial combination of the Substitutes and Original Item.


        If Provided or Delivery Service items associated with a Product Item are present in the input, quantity is calculated based on the association. Calculation of quantity in additional dimensions of weight and volume is done if the resource pool has capacity limited in those dimensions.

        If Provided or Delivery Service items associated with a Product Item are present in the input xml and their quantity is calculated based upon association, and if the product item is substituted, then quantities availability for the Service lines will be done based upon the association with the original product item. Quantity will not be recomputed for the Provided and Delivery service items based upon association of the PS/DS items with the new substituted item.

        Note: Do not pass system reserved LOW or HIGH date for ReqStartDate, ReqEndDate. Target a logical and smaller window for better performance.
        Inventory supplies and demands of the item at the nodes that are being marked as having incorrect inventory picture will not be considered in findInventory logic when CheckInventory is passed as Y. This is also true for nodes that have infinite inventory. If USE_FUTURE_SUPPLY_OF_INVENTORY_CONTROL_NODE rule is set to Y, future inventory supply of nodes, which are being marked as having incorrect inventory picture, will be considered.

        The on-hand safety factor will be excluded from on-hand inventory availability based on the following logic when the ApplyOnhandSafetyFactor flag on the scheduling rule is set to Y.

        • If OnhandSafetyFactorQuantity or OnhandSafetyFactorPercentage is configured for the item, it will be excluded from the current availability of the item at the node with a node type that has ApplyOnhandSafetyFactor = Y for each requested node, tag, segment type and segment combination. (Note: On-hand safety factor will only be applied to supplies with supply type that has a corresponding record in the YFS_INV_AVAIL_SAFETY_FACTOR table).
        • Otherwise if on-hand supply type has a safety factor percentage configured, it will be excluded from the supplies with that supply type for the item at the node with node type that has ApplyOnhandSafetyFactor = Y for each requested node, tag, segment type and segment combination.

        The future safety factor will be excluded from future inventory availability based on the following logic when the ApplyFutureSafetyFactor flag on the scheduling rule is set to Y.

        • If FutureSafetyFactorPercentage is configured for the item, it will be excluded from the current availability of the item at the node with a node type that has ApplyFutureSafetyFactor = Y for each requested node, tag, segment type and segment combination. (Note: Future safety factor will only be applied to supplies with supply type that has a corresponding record in the YFS_INV_AVAIL_SAFETY_FACTOR table).
        • Otherwise if future supply type has a safety factor percentage configured, it will be excluded from the supplies with that supply type for the item at the node with node type that has ApplyFutureSafetyFactor = Y for each requested node, tag, segment type and segment combination.

        The additional required capacity for each service line will be computed based on the additional capacity for region and service type configuration. The region that the ship to address falls under and the service type of the service item will be used.

        If customer information is provided, the slots in PromiseServiceLine will be returned based upon the customer's slot preference configuration. Note that slots which cannot be used for appointment planning will not be used for finding the possible options.

        • If customer's slot preference type is HARD, only preferred slots will be returned.
        • If customer's slot preference type is SOFT, all available slots will be returned. Preferred slots will have Preferred=Y. Other slots will have Preferred=N.
        • If customer's slot preference type is NONE, all available slots will be returned with Preferred=N.
        The required capacity will also be affected by the customer's answer sets, if applicable.

        Global Trade Item Number (GTIN)
        When availability is read across items sharing same GTIN, api does not replace requested item with actual item in output.

        Customer Scheduling Preferences
        The following constraints can now be defined and used by souring: OptimizationType, Ship Complete, Ship Line Complete, Ship Single Node, Ship Line Single Node. Most restrictive rule between scheduling rule and customer constraints will be applied. Allow Drop Ship Chained Order Creation can also be specified in customer scheduling constraints. If this flag is N, then option with drop ship will not be considered.

        Cost Based Sourcing
        While looking for availability if landed cost is used and optimizing on cost, option with the least cost will be selected as best option. Cost will consist of item cost, handling cost, procurement cost, and transportation cost. Item cost can be computed internally using Average Cost Method with Replacement Cost Computation or externally. Handling and Transportation cost will be computed internally based on weight, distance, and quantity. Transportation to customer will be computed using routing functionality. If all nodes are known prior to scheduling, cost will not be computed, since it will not change the output. Additionally node priority can be converted into cost. By multiplying node priority in a distribution group by node priority cost factor additional cost will be added to the total cost. Also, by multiplying consumption percentage for the ship date by node consumption percentage cost factor, additional cost will be added to the total cost. Based on the output XML template, the breakdown of costs will be available for the suggested option, as well as other options.

        Smart Sourcing

        If the organization allows smart sourcing and the sourcing rule detail also allows it, the smart nodes will be determined by the data provided in YFS_INVENTORY_ALERTS table. The data found in the alerts will be filtered based on the sourcing rule detail being used. When sourcing rule details are configured to only consider nodes with onhand inventory, the only alerts where the ALERT_TYPE is 'REALTIME_ONHAND' will be considered. If only inventory available in the next few days are considered, only those alerts with ONHAND_AVAILBLE_DATE or FIRST_FUTUTE_AVAILABLE_DATE before those number of days will be conisdered. Finally, if sourcing only considers nodes with available capacity in the next few days, only those alerts whose dates are prior to that date will be considered. All alerts will be ordered depending on the optimization type used by promising. If optimizing on date, then alerts will be ordered by ONHAND_AVAILABLE_DATE then by FIRST_FUTURE_AVAILABLE_DATE. If optimizing on cost using landed cost, alerts will be ordered by their ESTIMATED_COST. Anything else will use the alert's LATITUDEand LONGITUDE values to order by distance to the shipping address. Up to the configured number of smart nodes will be added due to high availability.

        In addition to the above, the top 5 common nodes across all product lines will be considered as well. If there are more than 5 common nodes, then the top 5 will be chosen in an undetermined nature.

        If a valid option cannot be produced given the smart nodes (for example, ship together bundle), only those nodes that had inventory in the alerts will be considered.

        Transfer Schedules
        When transfer between two nodes are required and a transfer schedule exists between the two, the transfer schedule will be used in determining shipment dates and arrival/delivery dates between the two nodes. If a transfer schedule has cut-offs defined, then these cut-offs will override any shipping calendar configuration. For example, if your procurement node has calendar shifts from 08:00 - 12:00 and 13:00 - 17:00, uses end of shift, and has a transfer schedule with a cut-off at 15:00, the shipment date from the procurement node will be 15:00.

        Forwarding/Transfers
        Forwarding options will be considered by scheduling when optimizing on cost. Forwarding location will be determined by either specifying it on the line or using routing configuration. Dates will be computed to reflect forwarding. Also if forwarding location is determined using routing, it will be populated on order line schedule as Merge Node. In cases when minimizing cost, transfers (which are modelled as procurements) will be considered to minimize number of shipments. In such cases if specified relationship type exists between any two shipping nodes currently being looked at, transfer will be used if it minimizes number of shipments to the customer.

        Use Of Routing Guide In Sourcing
        When considering cost and/or forwarding, routing will be used to determine cost based on carriers. Also routing will be used to determine forwarding (break-bulk) location. In order to use routing, shipments will be dynamically generated based on the LineGroupID. Internally determineRouting api will be called. If the carrier passed in the input or on the line is not in the routing guide as an option, no SCAC will be returned in the output.

        Node Notification
        The earliest date an item can be expected to ship is based on the minimum notification time configurable at the item, classification, or node levels. The NodeNotification that matches todays date will determine which minimum notification time for the node will be used. The largest between the item and node will be used for minimum notification time. If there aren't any NodeNotificationSchedules defined for the node, the minimum notification time will be applied to today's date based on the node's shipping calendar. If there is a NodeNotificationSchedule, the minimum notification time will be applied to the next notification time using the node's shipping calendar.

        Gift Wrap
        While looking for availability, if the GiftWrap servcie is requested for a line, then then the item availability will be considered only from the nodes which provide gift wrap services.

        Availability of Model Items
        When determining availability of model items, availability will be read across all the children items as well to determine the availability of model item. Refer to getATP for more details.

        Node Capacity
        During availability check, capacity for a particular node will be checked against the resource pool whose purpose is defined as INVENTORY. If enough capacity and inventory exists for a particular ship date, then the ship date will be considered. However, if capacity is not available, the choice will be delayed to a day that has enough capacity. Quantity will not be split across days due to capacity constraint.

        Carrier Service Determination
        To determine possible carrier services, the flag DetermineCarrierService has to be passed as "Y". Promise line assignments are generated with the carrier services available at the node. Carrier service schedules will be considered during possible assignments generation. If there are two carrier services that pickup from a node, one can pick up today and another in two days, we will generate two assignments. First assignment will have ship date as today, Ship date for the second assignment will be two days from now. Shipping capacity will be considered based on the expected shipment date (as before). Delivery date for the assignment will be calculated as the earliest of possible delivery dates across the carrier services that can ship on a given date.
        NOTE: Deliver together bundles will not work with dynamic carrier determination.

        Promise Line Assignments Manipulation
        You can manipulate promise line assignments by implementing the user exit OMPGetExternalCostForOptionsUE. Using the UE, you can reject any of the assignments. You can also overwrite costs or filter out carrier services for assignments. *@param env Required. Environment handle returned by createEnvironment.

        Enable Segment Based Allocation
        If Segment based allocation rule is enabled and if the unsegmented inventory is allowed to be consumed for the segment type, promising and promising UEs would consider both matching segment and unsegmented supplies. If the total segmented quantity is insufficient to meet the demand, the entire quantity(for both matching segment and unsegmented supplies) at each node will be considered.

        How Promising Works
        Promising works in a 6 step process:
        1. Add nodes from the sourcing rule detail.
        2. Read inventory for all the nodes required.
        3. Read capacity for all the nodes required.
        4. Compute the dates (aka Assignments) for the nodes with inventory.
        5. Solve for an optimal solution.
        6. Go to step 1 if any quantity is backordered.

        Integration with Inventory Visibility (phase 2.0) enabled:
        Features not supported in IV- availability by tag, segment, items with variation, GTIN, VMI, time-sensitive breakdown, multi-brand won't be supported.
        User exits com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetExternalSupplyUE, com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetSupplyCorrectionsUE, com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetDemandCorrectionsUE won't be supported with IV integration.
        Instead of reading supplies and demands from IV, node availability api of IV shall be invoked and the availabilities at node/s will be modelled as supplies.

        Parameters:
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.
        Returns:
        For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
